VirtualBox Ubuntu guest DNS lookups failing after Mac host wake from sleep

12 JUN 2013 Paul Jolly LONDON
  • MAC
  • VIRTUALBOX

I run Ubuntu Linux as a guest operating system within VirtualBox on my MacBook Pro

Often (and for some reason more often than not lately) when I open my Mac to wake it from sleeping, Ubuntu has lost the ability to do a DNS lookup. ping to any IP address works, but DNS is entirely broken.

This problem was reported in Oct 2012 and reported as being fixed in version >= 4.1 of VirtualBox. At the time of writing I am running 4.2.12 and yet still see the problem. The solution for now appears to be to run the following command from the host (as the previously linked bug report suggests):

VBoxManage modifyvm VMNAME --natdnshostresolver1 on
